title: 108_hr1336
content: SECTION 1. PREMIUMS FOR MORTGAGE INSURANCE. Premiums paid for qualified mortgage insurance in connection with acquisition indebtedness for a qualified residence shall be treated as qualified residence interest for tax purposes, with a 10 percent phaseout reduction. Premiums for qualified mortgage insurance can be reduced by 10 percent for each $1,000 that the taxpayer's adjusted gross income exceeds $100,000. The term "qualified mortgage insurance" refers to mortgage insurance provided by the taxpayer. The taxpayer can reduce premiums for qualified mortgage insurance by 10 percent for each $1,000 that their adjusted gross income exceeds $100,000. Qualified mortgage insurance includes insurance provided by government agencies or private insurers. Any amount paid for qualified mortgage insurance that extends beyond the taxable year is chargeable to capital. The taxpayer can reduce premiums for qualified mortgage insurance by 10 percent for each $1,000 that their adjusted gross income exceeds $100,000. Amounts paid for qualified mortgage insurance beyond the taxable year are chargeable to capital and treated as paid in allocated periods. No deduction is allowed for the unamortized balance if the mortgage is satisfied early. This does not apply to insurance provided by government agencies. SEC. 2. INFORMATION RETURNS RELATING TO MORTGAGE INSURANCE. Section 6050H of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to require individuals receiving $600 or more in mortgage insurance premiums to make a return to the Secretary. This return must contain prescribed information and be furnished to each individual. Individuals receiving $600 or more in mortgage insurance premiums must make a return to the Secretary and provide a written statement to each individual by January 31 of the following year. Special rules apply, including definitions of mortgage insurance from various agencies. The Homeowners Protection Act of 1998 defines private mortgage insurance for individuals receiving $600 or more in premiums. The amendments made by this Act regarding private mortgage insurance apply to amounts paid or accrued after the date of enactment in taxable years ending after such date.
